summary: The implementation covers most requirements well. REQ-1 (backend), REQ-2 (login), REQ-3 (dashboard with deterministic scores), REQ-6 (risk analysis), and REQ-7 (visual theme) are fully implemented. However, REQ-4 and REQ-5 use Recharts instead of react-chartjs-2/Chart.js as explicitly required, and the required Chart.js component registrations are absent. A ProfileSetupModal and authorization mixin were added without being requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: Line chart must use react-chartjs-2 and Chart.js with all required Chart.js components registered (CategoryScale, LinearScale, PointElement, LineElement, BarElement, Title, Tooltip, Legend)
missing_requirements.reason: ScreenTimeChart.tsx uses Recharts (LineChart, Line from 'recharts'), not react-chartjs-2/Chart.js. No Chart.js component registrations are present anywhere in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Bar chart must use react-chartjs-2 and Chart.js
missing_requirements.reason: AppUsageChart.tsx uses Recharts (BarChart, Bar from 'recharts'), not react-chartjs-2/Chart.js.

hallucinated_features.description: ProfileSetupModal â€” a modal prompting new users to enter their name on first login
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request does not specify any profile setup or onboarding modal. This feature was added without being requested.

hallucinated_features.description: AccessControl/authorization mixin applied to backend actor methods with permission checks that trap unauthorized callers
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request only asks for per-user keyed query/update methods. Adding MixinAuthorization, AccessControl, and permission checks was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Notification bell button in the Dashboard navbar
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request specifies the navbar should show app name, user identity info, and a logout button only. A bell/notification button was not requested.
